definition: Braille (name)/Louis Braille (1809-1852), French educator who invented braille
cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known
name of weed plant (fat hen, goosefoot, pigweed etc)/Chenopodium album

sentences.chinese: 現在我們不需要布萊葉了。

sentences.english: A few years later, Braille went to a special school for the blind in Paris.
sentences.chinese: 幾年後，布萊葉來到巴黎一所爲盲人開設的特殊學校。

sentences.english: One time, Braille spoke before a group of people.
sentences.chinese: 有一次，布萊葉在一羣人前演講。

sentences.english: A lot of the blind can read the Braille.
sentences.chinese: 在一所盲人學校，安妮學了布萊葉盲文。

sentences.english: At an institution for the blind, Annie learned braille.
sentences.chinese: 在一所盲人學校，安妮學了布萊葉盲文。

sentences.english: They were also the fastest Braille readers in the group.
sentences.chinese: 他們閱讀布萊葉盲文的速度也最快。
